timeline.name: Gen 1 Prototype Column Assembly
timeline.description: The Gen 1 Prototype Column Assembly used pixels left over from the beam assembly to experiment with different cross-sectional configurations, including the two-piece column and the four-piece column.

timeline.name: Gen 1 Prototype Shear Test
timeline.description: The Gen 1 Prototype Shear Test used pixels from the first round of prototyping to find the coefficient of friction between the concrete and aluminum at the intersection of the intermediate plate and pixels. Pixels were tested to failure, with most being retired after this test due to extensive damage.

timeline.name: Gen 1 Prototype Biennale Column
timeline.description: The Gen 1 Biennale Column is the oldest Pixelframe assembly still in circulation today - its pixels have been disassembled and reassembled many times, bearing marks of past load tests and reconfigurations.
